question: Dr. Niko Topopolosis?
answer: It's Tatopoulos.

question: Right. The worm guy. Can someone get those people off the beach?
answer: Excuse me, would you mind telling me what the hell I'm doing here?

question: Follow me.
answer: You didn't answer my question. In fact, for the last 18 hours no one has answered any of my questions.

question: We have a situation on our hands that requires your particular expertise.
answer: Look, I may work for the Nuclear Regulatory Commission but accidents and spills are not my field.

question: We know.
answer: Do you know that you just interrupted a three year study of the Chernobyl earthworm?

question: Yeah, you're the worm guy.
answer: The radioactive contamination in that area altered the earthworm's DNA! You have any idea what that means?

question: No, but I have the feeling I'm about to find out.
answer: It means that due to a man made accident the Chernobyl earthworms are now over seventeen percent larger than they were before. Mutated by seventeen percent?

question: Seventeen percent, huh? Sounds big.
answer: They're enormous! A new species created by man's recklessness. That's what I've been trying to tell you, I'm only a biologist. I take radioactive samples and study them.

question: Then you're perfect. Here's your radioactive sample. Study it.
answer: What sample?

question: You're standing on it.
answer: I don't see it. Where is it? I don't see it! That was a footprint. I was standing inside a footprint.

question: That's right.
answer: But there's no animal in the world that can make prints like that? Is there?

question: We're hoping you're going to help us figure that out.
answer: Somebody must have seen it.

question: It happened so fast no one knew what hit them 'til is was over. A tanker was attacked and sunk yesterday near the French Polynesians. We think there's a connection.
answer: Hi. Nick Tatopoulos...

question: Murray wants these copied to each field producer... And I'm supposed to remind you to call him on all of Caiman's expense p.o.'s.
answer: Speak of the devil.

question: Think I should ask him? I'm going to ask him. You think I should? I will.
answer: Oh girl...

question: Did you talk with Humphries?
answer: This is not the place...

question: Just tell me, did you talk with him?
answer: He said he'd consider it. It's between you and Rodriguez.

question: Are you serious? He's going to consider me for he job? What else did he say?
answer: Why don't I tell you over dinner tonight? Your place.

question: Mr. Caiman, you're married.
answer: And you're beautiful...

question: Mr. Caiman...
answer: Call me Charlie.

question: Mr. Caiman, I've been doing extra research for you after hours and weekends for nearly a year. And I've never asked for anything but this job is really important to me. I'm too old to be an assistant anymore. I need to know this job is going someplace.
answer: So have dinner with me tonight.

question: I can't.
answer: It's your choice.

question: Three years digging up worms in Chernobyl? How did Mrs. Tatopoulos handle it?
answer: Oh, I'm not married.

question: Really? A girlfriend then?
answer: No. Perhaps I work too much.

question: You mean to tell me that there is no one who holds a special place in your heart?
answer: Not for a long time, now.

question: Well, I think you're cute.
answer: Oh, thank you. Is she always like this?

question: Who are they? Lieutenant, get those people away from there.
answer: They are with me!

question: And who are you?
answer: CHARGEURES, property and casualty insurance. We are preparing a report.

question: You're fast.
answer: That is our job.

question: Well your people are getting in the way of my job.
answer: Major, what do you think could have done this?

question: Sure I was. I thought Lucy was gonna kill me.
answer: Damned right, you crazy Wop!

question: Gotta go, honey. You guys gonna be all right?
answer: Audrey's going to stay with us tonight.

question: Caiman, wait. Take me with you.
answer: What?

question: I've got something on this. I know a guy on the inside with the military...
answer: Not now. You got my bag?

question: You don't understand, I can get us information...
answer: Listen, this is the time when the big boys have to go to work, okay Honey? The bag?

question: Well this is great! If we're wrong on this evacuation they'll string me up from the Liberty torch. Who the hell are they? I don't have time for this nonsense. I share your concerns. I want to get the city back in business as soon as possible.
answer: Who waits for the Mayor. The Mayor is momentarily stopped. CHARGURES Insurance. We represent nearly thirteen percent of the buildings in your city.

question: If you'll excuse me...
answer: We are very happy that you are in control of this situation. You can count on our emotional and financial support.

question: What the hell are you doing?
answer: Remember my friend we saw on t.v.?

question: Your old sweetheart?
answer: Yeah, well he just turned up in New Jersey at the military command post. Somehow all this is related to what happened down in Panama. There's a story here. I know it. You got any tape or glue?

question: I left my forgery kit back at the office.
answer: Hey, do you have any glue in your bag? Can I use some? The warm feeling of helping your fellow man. You're kidding, right? Wish me luck!

question: Audrey, I don't think this is a very good idea. Caiman finds out and he'll have your job.
answer: I'm tired of waiting for someone else to give me an opportunity, Luce. If there's a story here I'm going to find it.

question: Christ. How many tunnels lead off the island? Have them sealed off. Fill them with cement, brick them up, put land mines in them, bombs, I don't know, just make sure that goddamned thing doesn't leave the island!
answer: You know, he's not an enemy trying to evade you. He's just an animal.

question: What are you suggesting?
answer: When I needed to catch earthworms, I knew the best way to catch them was not to chase them. I had to draw them out. All we need to do is find out what it wants, what it needs, and he'll come to us.

question: Fire at will!
answer: Fire at will. Fire at will.

question: O'Neal, what the hell is going on there!?
answer: He's gone, Sir. Echo division's in pursuit.

question: It's okay, I'll get out here. Do you have any home pregnancy tests? Especially ones that test for catastrophic hormones or clomiphene citrate. I'll take them all.
answer: You must have quite some harem.

question: Audrey?! Is that you? Hi, hello. You look, wow, uh, how've you been?
answer: It's good to see you, Nick.

question: So you made it.
answer: What?

question: You're a reporter. That's what you always wanted to be, right? I'm happy for you. Really, I am.
answer: Yeah, well... So, you still picking apart cockroaches?

question: No, I'm into earthworms now. You wouldn't be interested. They're real "boring" creatures. Very reliable, dependable, no surprises...
answer: You're still mad at me, aren't you?

question: You just left me without a phone call, a letter, nothing. All this time. Yeah, I guess I'm still a little mad.
answer: That was eight years ago. Some people change, you know.

question: Most people don't.
answer: I'm sorry you feel that way.

question: Wait. I'm sorry. You're right. Eight years is a long time. Can I offer you a cup of tea?
answer: Sure. I'd like that. One, thing, though. Who'd you get pregnant? I still can't believe it. How does a guy go from an anti-nuke activists to working for the Nuclear Regulatory Commission?

question: When you and I use to attend rallies in college, we helped to create awareness. But from the inside now I can actually effect change. I never lost my idealism.
answer: And exactly what changes are you trying to effect?

question: I have this theory that we're inadvertently creating new species as a direct result of what we've done to nature.
answer: And you think this creature is one of them?

question: Yes. The first of its kind. I found this blood sample earlier this evening...
answer: Blood sample? How close did you get to that thing?

question: I got pretty close.
answer: What else do you know about it?

question: Well, we know he eats fish, he's of reptile genus, he's a burrower, he's amphibious and... ...he's pregnant.
answer: Are you sure?

question: Well, obviously these tests weren't designed for this but fundamentally they're looking for the same hormonal patterns that would indicate pregnancy.
answer: I don't get it. If it's the first of its kind, how can it be pregnant?

question: The ultimate expression of evolution, it reproduces asexually. Think about it, all kinds of creatures have been known to travel great distances for reproduction. That's why he came to New York. Like every species of insufficient progenitors, he's nesting!
answer: Nesting?

question: Yes. Do you realize that a creature like this could lay as many as a dozen eggs at a time! Forgive me but I've got to get this into the lab, to confirm all this. I'll be right back. Audrey? Audrey?
answer: ...which is why in this case "all the kings horses and all the kings men" may not be able to put the big apple together again. Audrey Timmons, WNEW. So, what do you think?

question: What do you mean Murray's not there? A second ago you told me he was on the other line...
answer: Newark airport.

question: You're leaving? Why? Is this cause of me? Because of the story?
answer: Well what the hell did you think was going to happen?

question: You never said it was off the record.
answer: I shouldn't have to, Audrey. You're supposed to be my friend. I trusted you.

question: I didn't mean for it to turn out like this. Look, I lied to you. I'm not a reporter. When we broke up and I came out to New York I was so sure I'd make it. But I haven't. That's why I needed this story so bad. I just couldn't tell you I'm a failure.
answer: So you thought that made it okay to steal my tapes? Good luck in your new career. I think you really have what it takes.

question: Pernot, no ice.
answer: Do I know you?

question: We've met before.
answer: Oh yeah, the insurance guy.

question: SDECE, Service de Documentation Exterieure et de Contre-Espionnage. Agent Phillip Raymond.
answer: Sounds like a big company.

question: It's the French Secret Service.
answer: Oh.

question: We have learned that your American friends have decided not to look for the creature's nest.
answer: Are you sure? How do you know?

question: We know.
answer: Why are you telling this to me?

question: I need you to trust me.
answer: Why do you need that?

question: I need your trust if you're to help me find the nest.
answer: Oh, my bags. I've checked them in.

question: How did you get all of this stuff into the country?
answer: This is America. There is nothing you can not buy.

question: So why all the secrecy? Why aren't you guys working with the US military?
answer: I am not permitted to speak of such things.

question: You said you wanted my trust, then I need yours.
answer: I am a patriot. I love my country. Can you understand that?

question: Sure.
answer: It is my job to protect my country. Sometimes I must even protect it from itself. From mistakes we have made. Mistakes that we do not want the world to know about.

question: Your talking about the nuclear testing in the Pacific.
answer: Yes. This testing done by my country left a terrible mess. We are here to clean it up.

question: Who the hell are all these people?
answer: What? I just couldn't just let them sleep in the street.

question: Where's Audrey?
answer: In the bedroom. Crying her eyes out because of you.

question: What?
answer: All that "you gotta be vicious" stuff you filled her head with.

question: Me!? You where the one...
answer: Go in there. Talk to her.

question: Stupid idiots!
answer: You okay?

question: It's all my fault. What have I done, Animal? What have I become? Look at me. This isn't me. I don't do things like this.
answer: You made a mistake.

question: Yeah, I just screwed up with the only man who ever really cared about me.
answer: Didn't you tell me he left for the airport?

question: Yeah. Why are you asking?
answer: I just saw him. He's with a bunch of guys who want to sneak into the city tonight.

question: My God. He's going after the nest.
answer: Perfect! You wanted a story, well, baby, you got one.

question: Animal, I can't.
answer: Look, you want to make it up to your friend? Well if he's right, this is your chance.

question: I don't know. I've already made such a mess of things...
answer: Audrey, I'm going after them. You can come with me or not.

question: What are you doing?
answer: Lucy'd kill me if she knew.

question: Are we locked on?
answer: Locked on, Captain.

question: Fire.
answer: He's shifted course, Sir. He's heading back towards Manhattan.

question: Full ahead. Close in and lock on.
answer: Locked on, Sir.

question: Fire!
answer: Impact in eight seconds, seven, six... ...five, four, three... Direct hit!

question: Hey, it's me!
answer: What happened?

question: They're loose. They're allover the main lobby. I couldn't get out.
answer: Who the hell are you?

question: What about the phones?
answer: Circuits are overloaded.

question: I know a way. I know how you can get a message out of here. This way. Come on, the broadcast booth is right over here.
answer: How do you know?

question: Our network covers the Ranger games. The network is on an intranet. It's a direct feed into our computer system.
answer: Your station won't have any easier time contacting the military than I did.

question: Cut uptown, take 8th to 57th then cut up Broadway.
answer: You're crazy, go to the east side and take the park avenue to the JFK.

question: The JFK? In the rain!?
answer: What are you talking about? The east side is always faster.

question: Hello?
answer: It's Raymond.

question: Where are you?
answer: Tell your friends I will send the tape after I remove a few items from it.

question: I understand.
answer: I just wanted to say, au revoir and thank you for your help, my friend.
